articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Europe praises as Belarus scorns 2022 Nobel Peace Prize for rights defenders - 9News
articles.description: Officials in Europe praised the awarding of this year's Nobel Peace Prize to activists standing up for human rights and democracy in Russia, Belarus and Ukraine while authorities in Belarus scorned the move.

articles.author: Chris Pleasance
articles.title: UK energy crisis will be worse next year than this year, expert warns - Daily Mail
articles.description: James Rogers, co-founder of the think-tank Council on Geostrategy, told MailOnline that Europe can get through this winter because it stockpiled Russia gas before the supplies were cut off.
articles.content:
Amidst warnings of three-day blackouts and industry shut-downs in Britain if the months ahead turn particularly cold, you might be forgiven for thinking that this is the winter of our discontent.
We… [+8868 chars]

articles.author: Story by Reuters
articles.title: Covid wave looms in Europe as booster campaign makes slow start - CNN
articles.description: A new Covid-19 wave appears to be brewing in Europe as cooler weather arrives, with public health experts warning that vaccine fatigue and confusion over types of shots available will likely limit booster uptake.
articles.content: A new Covid-19 wave appears to be brewing in Europe as cooler weather arrives, with public health experts warning that vaccine fatigue and confusion over types of shots available will likely limit bo… [+3752 chars]

articles.title: The Western Cape has another plan to move away from load shedding - BusinessTech
articles.description: The Western Cape government has been on an investment drive to Europe, exploring ways to make the province more energy efficient.
articles.content:
The Western Cape government has been on an investment drive to Europe, exploring ways to make the province more energy efficient.
